message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.HC. 

This paper is about an optimised multi-modal dialogue agent for interactive learning of visually grounded word meanings from a human tutor, trained on real human-human tutoring data. The paper discusses the use of Reinforcement Learning (RL) to train the agent, which is a popular technique in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the study of computational aspects of language and the design of algorithms for natural language processing. 

The paper also discusses the use of machine learning techniques such as RL to train the agent, which falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper discusses the evaluation of the system in interaction with a simulated human tutor, which involves the use of machine learning techniques such as supervised learning and reinforcement learning, which fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.CV (Computer Vision), respectively. Finally, the paper discusses the goal of minimising human effort in the learning process, which falls under the sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
